just_filmi_article.lead_et:
**Turvajuhised ja n√µuanded P√ñFFi k√ºlastajatele**

P√ñFF 24 tuleb koroonaviiruse t√µttu teistsugune kui varasemad ‚Äì esimest korda saab filme vaadata nii kinodes kui ka veebis. Teeme koost√∂√∂d meditsiiniettev√µtetega SYNLAB ja Medicum ning perearstikeskusega Sinu Arst, samuti konsulteerime Terviseametiga, et tagada kinok√ºlastajatele turvaline keskkond ning v√§ltida koroonaviiruse levikut festivaliga seotud √ºritustel.

Hoolime oma k√ºlastajatest v√§ga ja soovime, et festivalielamus oleks k√µigile v√µimalikult meeldiv, mugav ja turvaline. P√ñFF kestab kaks ja pool n√§dalat ning selleks, et j√µuaksime koos teiega eduka l√µpuni, oleme koostanud allolevad juhised ja reeglid:

- Tungivalt soovitame osta piletid P√ñFFi v√µi Piletilevi kodulehelt. Kodust pileti ostmine on lihtne, mugav ja turvaline.
- Kogu festivaliinfo on leitav P√ñFFi kodulehelt. Kui j√§√§d h√§tta, siis kirjuta info@poff.ee. Aitame Sind hea meelega.
- P√ñFFi infopunkti palume festivali ajal k√ºlastada √§√§rmisel vajadusel. Meie k√µigi huvides on see, et piletikassadesse ei tekiks j√§rjekordi. J√§rgime 2+2 reeglit. 
- Festivali √ºritustel ja -alal on maskide kandmine rangelt soovituslik. Seansile v√µib tulla oma maskiga. Kui Sul maski ei ole, saad selle festivalialale sisenedes meie vabatahtlikult tasuta. 
- Kui Sa ostad pileti siiski P√ñFFi kassast, ole valmis selleks, et pilet isikustatakse. Selleks k√ºsitakse Sinu andmeid. Oma istekohti saalis muuta ei tohi. 
- Enne saali sisenemist v√µidakse valikuliselt m√µ√µta k√ºlastajate kehatemperatuuri. Juhul, kui tunned ennast halvasti, palume Sul koju j√§√§da ja vaadata meie filme veebis.
- Festivalikinodes on desinfitseerimisvahendid, mida palume k√µigil kasutada.
- Seansside vaheajal puhastame ja desinfitseerime k√µiki kinosaale.
- P√§rast seansi l√µppu palume k√ºlastajaid saalist lahkuda ridade kaupa, et uste juurde ei tekiks troppe.


Mis saab Sinu piletist, kui seanss v√µi festival peaks COVID-19 viiruse t√µttu √§ra j√§√§ma?
- Loodame, et oled n√µus vahetama √§raj√§√§nud seansi pileti sama filmi j√§rgmise seansi pileti vastu. Kui soovitud filmi enam kinos ei ole, pakume v√µimalust vahetada pilet m√µne muu filmi pileti vastu v√µi vaadata sama filmi veebi vahendusel, kus n√§eb enamikku festivali filmidest.
- Soovijatel on v√µimalik ka √§raj√§√§nud seansi pileti eest makstud raha P√ñFFi toetuseks annetada. Piletitulu on meile √ºks olulisemaid sissetulekuallikaid ‚Äì eriti t√§navu, kui koroonaviirus on teinud filmit√∂√∂stuse ja kultuuri√ºrituste elu v√§ga keeruliseks. Annetamise puhul palume teavitada festivali aadressil kassa@poff.ee. 
- Kui √ºkski nendest lahendustest ei sobi, ostame Sinu pileti tagasi. 


Anname √ºheskoos endast parima, et 24. P√ñFF oleks sama √§ge ja turvaline elamus, nagu on olnud varasematel aastatel!

just_filmi_article.contents_et:
#### Piletiinfo
P√ñFFi info- ja m√º√ºgipunktid leiad nii Tallinnast kui Tartust. P√∂ffihundid leti taga on lahked ja abivalmid Sind piletiostul aitama, kui filmivalik esimese hooga silme eest kirjuks v√µtab. K√ºsi julgelt!

Just Filmi festivali pileteid on v√µimalik soetada alates **15. oktoobrist**!

**6. novembrist** on piletid m√º√ºgil ka P√ñFFi info- ja m√º√ºgipunktides Tallinnas Solaris Keskuses ja Coca-Cola Plazas. M√º√ºgipunktide lahtiolekuajad leiad [**siit**](https://poff.ee/artikkel/info-ja-muugipunktid/)!

Pilet 6 ‚Ç¨

Online linastuse pilet 6 ‚Ç¨

Sooduspilet 4.50 ‚Ç¨ (*)

Just Filmi pass 40 ‚Ç¨ (**)

(*) *Sooduspiletid kehtivad eelkooliealistele lastele, √µpilastele ja tudengitele.*

 (**) *Pass sisaldab 10 piletit Just Filmi seanssidele. Piletite arv √ºhele seansile ei ole piiratud.*


**Just Filmi Passi** ostmiseks v√µta meiega √ºhendust [justfilm@poff.ee](mailto:justfilm@poff.ee).
just_filmi_article.contents_en:
From the **15th of October** tickets can be purchased on Just Film website, all Piletilevi ticket counters across Estonia and from www.piletilevi.ee.

From the **6th of November **P√ñFF tickets are sold at P√ñFF Info and Ticket Centres at Solaris Centre and Coca-Cola Plaza. Opening times of the Info and Sales Centers can be found [**here**](https://poff.ee/en/about/info-and-sales-centers/).

Ticket price 6 ‚Ç¨ / Online screening entry 6 ‚Ç¨

Discount ticket 4,5 ‚Ç¨ *

Just Film badge 40 ‚Ç¨ **



 (*) Discount Tickets are valid for pre-school children, pupils and students when a respective identity document is presented upon entry to the venue.

 (**) Just Film badge consist of 10 tickets. Tickets per screening is not limited. Entering the cinema with badge is necessary.

Just Film badge can be bought by contacting us via [e-mail](justfilm@poff.ee).

just_filmi_article.contents_et:
Just Filmile saavad tulla k√µik, olenemata sellest, kus Eestimaa osas nad ka ei asu.
Just Filmi meeskond pakub koolidele v√µimalust tulla festivalile ekskursiooni raames. Just Filmi meeskond v√µtab enda peale nii transpordi broneerimise kui ka filmisoovituste jagamise.

Siin on 4 imelihtsat sammu, kuidas organiseerida omale bussiekskursioon Just Filmile:

SAMM 1
V√µta √ºhendust meie meeskonnaga. Sind aitab Heleen Sutt (heleen.sutt@poff.ee, 5205592). Esimesena paneme paika, mis p√§eval ja mis kell v√µiksite tulla Just Filmi raames kinno ning teeme teile hinnapakkumise.

SAMM 2
Kui aeg ja film on v√§lja valitud, siis broneerime teile bussi ja kohad kinosaalis. √ïpetajatele on ekskursioonil osalemine tasuta.

SAMM 3
Kes soovib Tallinnas ekskursioonil viibida kauem, siis ka selline v√µimalus on olemas. Selleks tuleb ekskursiooni tellijal tasuda bussi lisaootetundide eest.

SAMM 4
Eksursioonip√§eva hommikul on buss kokkulepitud ajal kooli ees, s√µidutab teid mugavalt kinno ja soovi korral ka muuseumisse. P√§rast filmi l√µppu viib buss k√µik √µpilased ja √µpetajad kooli juurde tagasi.


##### Filmimuuseumi pakkumine Just Filmi ekskursioonilistele

Programm "Filmi sisse minek" Just Filmi erihinnaga **4.50 √µpilane**.

Filmimuuseum pakub lastele v√µimalust kiigata filmit√∂√∂ telgitagustesse. Kes on re≈æiss√∂√∂r? Kuidas tehakse grimmi? Mis tunne on olla kaamera ees? Ja palju muud p√µnevat... Illusioonide ruumis saab ise oma k√§ega proovida, kuidas saadi pildid liikuma kaamerate-eelsel ajastul. Programm kestab ca 1,5 tundi ja sobib k√µikidele kooliastmetele.

Broneerimine¬†[tellimus@ajaloomuuseum.ee](tellimus@ajaloomuuseum.ee)
Lisainfo ja tellimuste haldur Tatjana Runge¬†5255976.

![haridusprogrammid.jpg](http://139.59.130.149/uploads/haridusprogrammid_31d6169479.jpg)



Lisainfo ekskursioonide kohta:

Heleen Sutt
heleen.sutt@poff.ee
520 5592

Kooligruppidel on v√µimalik pileteid ette broneerida. Selleks leiate lingi soovitud filmi linastusaja juurest.
Broneerimiseks on minimaalne v√§ljaostetavate piletite arv 5. V√§iksema arvu piletite soetamiseks saab kasutada¬†Piletilevi¬†keskkonda v√µi p√∂√∂rduda¬†P√ñFFi piletim√º√ºgikassadesse,¬†mis asuvad Solarise Keskuses ning Coca-Cola Plazas.

Veebikeskkonnas tehtud broneeringu¬†kohta tuleb teie meiliaadressile ka koopiakiri ning 1 t√∂√∂p√§eva jooksul l√µplik kinnitus broneeringu √µnnestumisest Just Filmi meeskonna poolt.

Lisainfo:¬†[justfilm@poff.ee](mailto:justfilm@poff.ee)
just_filmi_article.contents_en:
Through the booking system that can be found on film pages you can book tickets for your schoolgroup to Just Film screenings.
Minimum amount of tickets that can be booked is 5. To book less than 5 tickets, please use¬†Piletilevi¬†webpage or visit P√ñFF ticket sales offices at Solaris Centre, Coca-Cola Plaza and Tartu Kaubamaja.

Using the web based booking system you will receive a copy to your e-mail as well as a final confirmation of a successful booking from the Just Film team within 1 working day.

More info:¬†(justfilm@poff.ee)

just_filmi_article.contents_et:
Just Film on Pimedate √ñ√∂de Filmifestivali (P√ñFF) laste- ja noortefilmide alafestival, mis koosneb lastefilmide ja noortefilmide v√µistlusprogrammist ning eriprogrammidest. Just Film toimub igal aastal novembrikuus sarnaselt P√ñFFi p√µhiprogrammiga. N√§itamisele tulevad filmid, mida ka k√µige suurem filmis√µber igap√§evaselt naljalt n√§ha ei saa. M√µni neist ajab nutma, m√µni naerma, m√µni muudab elu. Midagi suup√§rast leiab igas vanuses kinok√ºlaline. Festivalil linastub igal aastal umbes 50 filmi ning oma publikuarvu juures on Just Filmist t√§naseks saanud Eesti √ºks suuremaid laste- ja noorte√ºritusi, mida igal aastal k√ºlastab kokku ligi 18 000 filmihuvilist.

Just Film loodi, et anda lastele ja noortele v√µimalus l√§bi filmikunsti n√§ha, mis toimub nende √ºmber ja mujal maailmas, r√§√§kida teemadest, mis on √ºhiskonna valupunktideks ning arendada oskust olla m√µistvam ja empaatiav√µimelisem. Eesm√§rk on seel√§bi kasvatada uue p√µlvkonna publikut, kes hindab k√µrgelt kvaliteetfilme ning n√§eb v√µimalust filmikunsti abil √ºhiskonda ja inimesi muuta.
Just Film annab ka oma panuse haridusse pakkudes √µpetajatele v√µimalust kaasata v√§√§rtfilme √µppet√∂√∂sse.
Me hindame k√µrgelt v√§√§rtusi nagu mitmekesisus, teineteisega arvestamine ja v√µrdsus. Just Filmi meeskond t√∂√∂tab selle nimel, et n√§idata lastele ja noortele, mida k√µike v√µib √ºks indiviid saavutada ‚Äì seda, et iga√ºks on oluline ja v√µimeline suurteks tegudeks hoolimata sellest, milline on tema taust v√µi staatus.
K√µigil soovijatel on v√µimalik koostada ka oma personaalne kava linastuvatest filmidest. Selleks, et teha oma kava, tuleb registreerida end Just Filmi kodulehel kasutajaks.

Ajalugu

-  1996. aastal loodud Pimedate √ñ√∂de Filmifestivalist on t√§naseks saanud Eesti ja Baltikumi √ºks olulisemaid kultuuris√ºndmusi. Samamoodi on kasvanud Baltikumi suurimaks laste‚Äì ja noortefilmide festivaliks P√ñFFi pesamuna Just Film.
-  2001. aastal loodud Just Film on t√§naseks kasvanud v√µrdv√§√§rseks festivaliks teiste omasarnaste seas. Tol aastal kutsus Tallinna Pimedate √ñ√∂de filmifestival kokku neli entusiastlikku ja tubli noort, kes hakkasid √ºheskoos tegema Just Filmi.

Tollane noor festivalijuht Elen Lotman vedas festivali j√§rgmised kaheksa aastat. Iga aastaga kasvas Just Filmi programm ning publikut tuli juurde ja mitte ainult Tallinnast.

Kinod

Just Filmi s√ºnnikodu oli Nukuteater, kus n√§idati nii laste- kui ka noortefilme. Kino S√µprus oli t√§navakultuuri eriprogrammi p√§ralt. Seitse aastat hiljem olid aga pisikesed ja armsad kinod j√§√§nud Just Filmi jaoks liiga v√§ikeseks ning festival oli sunnitud kolima kinno Kosmos, kuhu Just Film j√§i saatuse tahtel vaid √ºheks aastaks, sest peagi avati Tallinnas Solaris Keskus ja Cinamoni kino (t√§naseks nimega Solaris Kino). P√§rast edukat esimest aastat Solaris Kinos, laienes Just Film ka Tallinna teise suurkinno Coca-Cola Plaza. Need kaks on j√§√§nud t√§naseni Just Filmi kodukinodeks ning saanud festivali k√ºlastajatele armsaks.

Filmid

T√§naseks p√§evaks on Just Film toonud Eestisse kokku 436 t√§ispikka filmi v√§ga paljudelt kuulsatelt filmitegijatelt, nagu n√§iteks Gus van Sant, Vanessa Jopp, Tony Key. Lisaks kuulsatele re≈æiss√∂√∂ridele on festivali avamisele ja l√µpetamisele j√µudnud maailma suurimad ja populaarseimad laste- ja noortefilmid. Nii on seigeldud koos Harry Potteriga ning kaasa elatud libahuntide ja vampiiride s√µdadele Videviku saagades. Suured ja v√§ikesed filmihuvilised on saanud n√§ha uus-versioone ka filmidest ‚ÄúKalapoeg Nemo‚Äù ja ‚ÄúL√µvikuningas‚Äù.

Programmid

Just Filmil on alati olnud kaks p√µhilist programmi: lastefilmide programm ja noortefilmide programm. Lisaks neile kahele on festivalil linastunud ka palju eriprogramme, neist vanim on t√§navakultuuri eriprogramm. Lisandunud on ka Vitamiiniprogramm ja 2011. aastal ilmavalgust n√§inud laste ja noorte √µiguste eriprogramm.

Arhiiv

Just Filmi varasemad filmid leiad [siit](https://arhiiv.justfilm.ee)

just_filmi_article.contents_en:
Youth and Children‚Äôs Film Festival Just Film is the biggest sub-festival of Tallinn Black Nights Film Festivals. It is held during the main programme ‚Äì from the 13th until the 29th of November 2020. This year Just Film is celebrating its 20th jubilee.

Just Film was founded to give children and youth the possibility to see through film what happens around them and around the world. The aim is to show kids the critical points of society and to make them more understanding and empathic.

Just Film wants to be part of creating a society where people appreciate quality movies and see that together we really can change the world. Just Film contributes to education by offering teachers the opportunity to use quality films in their school programmes. We value diversity, respect and equality highly.

Just Film's team works to show children and young people what an individual can achieve - everyone is important and capable of doing great, regardless of their background or social status.

The programme consists of ~55 feature-length films that fall into different programmes ‚Äì youth film programme, children‚Äôs film programme, lifestyle and sport documentaries (Doc@Just), science documentaries (Science360) and the children‚Äôs rights programme. The latter celebrating its 10 year anniversary in 2020. In 2020 Just Film is also presenting a short-film category ‚Äì shorts for youth and shorts for kids.

Our main focus group is 13-25 year olds and we work very closely with schools and teachers in Estonia.

Just Film presents films in the following programmes:

International Competition programme for youth feature films

International Competition programme for children‚Äôs feature films

Non-competitive and / or informative programmes, retrospectives and special presentations

Films eligible for the programmes are feature-length (50 minutes and over) either fiction or documentary and, for the first time in Just Film history, we are looking for films in the short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes). All films must be produced after the 1st of January 2019 with a minimum requirement being their Estonian premiere.

Contact:

Festival Director ‚Äì Mikk Granstr√∂m

mikk@poff.ee

Programme Coordinator ‚Äì Maarit M√§nnama

maarit.mannama@poff.ee

just_filmi_article.contents_et:
P√ñFF ‚Äì BLACK NIGHTS FILM FESTIVAL SUBFESTIVAL 
Just Film 
Youth and Children‚Äôs Film Festival 
13.11.‚Äì29.11.2020
 
**Just Film presents films in the following programmes:**
International Competition programme of youth feature films 
International Competition programme of children‚Äôs feature films 
Non-competitive and / or informative programmes, retrospectives and special presentations
Films eligible for the programmes are feature-length (50 minutes and over) either fiction or documentary and short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes), produced after the 1st of January 2019 with a minimum requirement being their Estonian premiere. The festival reserves the right to evaluate eligible films for competition on a case by case basis. 
The applicable screening copies are in DCP format in English or include English subtitles. Films in the competitions may be presented in the P√ñFF main programme non-competitive section and touring screenings after Just Film.

**Awards & Prizes**
‚Ä¢	Just Film Grand Prix, International Youth Competition
‚Ä¢	Just Film Youth Jury Best Film Award
‚Ä¢	Just Film Youth Jury Best Youth Short Award
‚Ä¢	Just Film Children‚Äôs Jury Best Film Award
‚Ä¢	Just Film Children‚Äôs Jury Best Animated Short Award
‚Ä¢	ECFA Award
‚Ä¢	Up to two Special Mentions per Competitive Programme

**Juries**
The Festival Director will appoint the Domestic Children‚Äôs Jury and Youth Jury, both consisting of five members. Also an international jury consisting of three film specialists and ECFA (European Children‚Äôs Film Association) jury consisting of three ECFA members will be invited. No jury member can be involved in the production or promotion of any of the films in the competitive programs.
Film submission entry procedures
Applicants for Competitive and Non-Competitive Programmes are requested to submit as a subcategory of Black Nights Film Festival through FilmFreeway or any other submitting platform indicated by the festival team.
https://filmfreeway.com/just
Entry applications submitted by post, e-mail or any other form except the online submission form are not considered eligible for selection. 
The regular submission deadline for competitive and non-competitive feature film programmes is 1st of July 2020. The festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨49 Euros or $55 USD per film during the regular deadline. For short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes) the festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨9 Euros per film during regular deadline.
Discount code: use our Summer Sale code "SUMMER25" to recieve 25% of the entry fee. Discount is valid until the 1st of July.
The extended submission deadline for competitive and non-competitive feature film programmes is 17th of August 2020. The festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨65 Euros or $75 USD per film during extended deadline. For short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes) the festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨12 Euros per film during extended deadline.
The final submission deadline for competitive and non-competitive feature film programmes is 24th of August 2020. The festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨75 Euros or $85 USD per film during the regular deadline. For short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes) the festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨20 Euros per film during final submission deadline.
The Festival reserves the right to select films received at any time and through any means, or process and to refuse late submissions.
By submitting a film to the festival the applicant agrees by the submissions deadline to:
‚Ä¢	Fill and submit the entry form via the festival‚Äôs online submission form.
‚Ä¢	Provide a screening link and password via the online submission form or e-mail
‚Ä¢	Acknowledge that ‚Äúselected‚Äù status on the online submission or an any kind of automated letter from the submission platform form does not guarantee confirmation of the submitted film to the festival as the festival needs to consider multiple criteria, such as the screening fee, print/copy fees, availability issues in Estonian territory and other factors.
‚Ä¢	Deliver additional materials (biography and filmography of Director, stills of the film, synopsis of the film, trailer and poster art-work (if already available) by the means specified by the festival.
Confirmation of films and reimbursement
Upon selection of the film, the Festival will inform the applicant no later than 1st of October 2020.
The applicant agrees that confirmed titles may not be withdrawn from the festival programme after its participation has been officially confirmed and the producer or producer‚Äôs authorised representative has verified the confirmation of the film to the programme.
If, for exceptional reasons, the film has to be withdrawn three weeks or less before the opening of the festival, the applicant agrees to reimburse all costs to the festival related to the confirmation and programming of the film including screening fee (when applicable), print delivery and handling costs as well as associated travel costs for the film delegation.
The invoices for the film rights or print loans should be issued and delivered for payments no later than two months after the end of the festival. The festival does not accept or reimburse invoices issued after that date.
Upon confirmation of the film to the Just Film festival‚Äôs competitive or non-competitive sections the applicant agrees to:
‚Ä¢	Provide a trailer of the film either on DVD or online via a non-expiring link.
‚Ä¢	Deliver materials for localisation (subtitle files with time-codes and/or dialogue lists in the original film language and in English, spotting list and a screener of the finalised version of the).
‚Ä¢	Grant permission to include the screener in the festivals video library, reserved for jury and accredited industry members only (restricted access). The film representative will be requested to upload the screener into the secure video library environment.
Materials have to be delivered digitally to maarit.mannama[a]poff.ee. The festival does not accept deliveries on hard disk drives, memory sticks or any other physical format, as well as via file sharing programs or services such as Dropbox, Google Drive, Box etc.
Technical requirements and guidelines for film formats
The accepted screening format for all films in competition and non-competition sections is DCP. Provided DCPs must be DCI compliant (www.dcimovies.com) and adhere to all applicable conditions below.
DCPs must be provided and shipped on industry standard and protected hard drives or delivered digitally with previous confirmation from the festival technical department. Consumer grade hard drives and memory sticks are not permitted.
All films selected for the festival must be provided with English subtitles, unless they are already in English. A selection will be translated into Estonian. If the transfer of translated subtitles onto the DCP is not agreed with the representative of the film, the translations will be shown electronically.
All screening copies for all sections, if provided with any subtitles, must have the subtitles on the active picture area and not in the letterbox area. Dubbed language copies are also refused.
The festival reserves the right to demand new DCP packages free of charge in case of non-compatible DCPs, files are on broken hard drives or other quality standards are not met. These include wrongly placed or missing subtitles, or wrong soundtracks.
Unencrypted DCPs are strongly preferred. In case of encrypted DCPs, the festival requires one test KDM per film free of charge for quality assurance and technical testing for our test-screen or DKDM for laboratory testing. The quality assurance purpose KDM or DKDM is requested to be valid from the date the DCP arrives at the festival till 2 days after the festival.
The producer or film representative is requested to provide appropriate screening KDMs valid from 3 days before the start of the festival and 2 days after the festival, but in minimum at least 72 hours prior to screenings, and 48 hours after the screening. The cost of generating all KDMs will also be the responsibility of the producers or representatives of the film.
If the festival is provided with broken or wrongly assigned KDMs, appropriate new KDMs must be provided free of charge by the film submitter or representative. Quality assurance purpose DKDM does not exempt from providing screening KDMs if not agreed upon otherwise.
The festival supports 2K and 4K content. However, not all screens have a 4K projecting capability. The festival therefore cannot guarantee that all 4K films will be screened in a 4K resolution.
The festival reserves the right to refuse and withdraw the screening of the film from the competition or any other section if all requirements are not followed.
Detailed technical guidelines will be available linked for download along with the festival regulations on the festival website from 1st of June 2020 and also provided along with confirmation entry form.
Our festival‚Äôs technical team, dcinema@poff.ee, will happily help with any queries for all confirmed films.
Delivery of materials
All costs related to the shipping of the screener copy (DVD) and publicity materials are paid by the submitter or film representative. Submitted preview copies may be returned to the submitter or forwarded only at the submitters expense.
All packages must be clearly marked with the title of the film, the sender‚Äôs / submitters name, return address and telephone number as well as the festival address:

Black Nights Film Festival
Attn: Just Film
Telliskivi 60a/2, 3rd floor
10412
Tallinn, Estonia
Phone: +372 56 208 308

Costs related to the shipping of the screening copies to the festival are paid by the festival, unless otherwise agreed upon. Return shipping costs are the responsibility of the submitter or film representative, or party appointed by them.
The festival will return or forward the screening copies within 14 days from the end of the festival unless instructed otherwise by the submitter or film representative. Returns before the Festival closing date must be agreed at least three weeks before the festival, and cannot be guaranteed after that.
The festival covers all expenses connected to the storage and insurance of the screening copies during the duration of the festival.
In the event of damage to a copy during the event, the Festival limits its responsibility to the cost of having a new standard copy made at current laboratory rates.
Film Delegations
For competitive programmes the Festival will invite one representative per film. The festival will cover the round trip airfare for one delegate, with a preference given to the Director and/or a Main Cast member, as well as accommodation for up to 1 guest in the Delegation at the Official Partner Hotel.
For non-competitive films, the Festival reserves the right to invite guests upon the decision of the Programming committee. Detailed terms and conditions for film delegates are provided on a non-disclosed one to one and guest agreement basis.
For non-competitive films, the Festival guest accreditation list will be closed one (1) day before the opening of the festival. After the deadline a fee of ‚Ç¨25 will be requested for festival accreditation from the non-competitive film delegates. 

Contact
Festival director ‚Äì Mikk Granstr√∂m, (mikk@poff.ee)
Programme coordinator ‚Äì Maarit M√§nnama, (maarit.mannama@poff.ee)
Submit your film to the Youth and Children's film festival Just Film!
just_filmi_article.contents_en:
P√ñFF ‚Äì BLACK NIGHTS FILM FESTIVAL SUBFESTIVAL 
Just Film 
Youth and Children‚Äôs Film Festival 
13.11.‚Äì29.11.2020
 
**Just Film presents films in the following programmes:**
International Competition programme of youth feature films 
International Competition programme of children‚Äôs feature films 
Non-competitive and / or informative programmes, retrospectives and special presentations
Films eligible for the programmes are feature-length (50 minutes and over) either fiction or documentary and short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes), produced after the 1st of January 2019 with a minimum requirement being their Estonian premiere. The festival reserves the right to evaluate eligible films for competition on a case by case basis. 
The applicable screening copies are in DCP format in English or include English subtitles. Films in the competitions may be presented in the P√ñFF main programme non-competitive section and touring screenings after Just Film.

**Awards & Prizes**
‚Ä¢	Just Film Grand Prix, International Youth Competition
‚Ä¢	Just Film Youth Jury Best Film Award
‚Ä¢	Just Film Youth Jury Best Youth Short Award
‚Ä¢	Just Film Children‚Äôs Jury Best Film Award
‚Ä¢	Just Film Children‚Äôs Jury Best Animated Short Award
‚Ä¢	ECFA Award
‚Ä¢	Up to two Special Mentions per Competitive Programme

**Juries**
The Festival Director will appoint the Domestic Children‚Äôs Jury and Youth Jury, both consisting of five members. Also an international jury consisting of three film specialists and ECFA (European Children‚Äôs Film Association) jury consisting of three ECFA members will be invited. No jury member can be involved in the production or promotion of any of the films in the competitive programs.
Film submission entry procedures
Applicants for Competitive and Non-Competitive Programmes are requested to submit as a subcategory of Black Nights Film Festival through FilmFreeway or any other submitting platform indicated by the festival team.
https://filmfreeway.com/just
Entry applications submitted by post, e-mail or any other form except the online submission form are not considered eligible for selection. 
The regular submission deadline for competitive and non-competitive feature film programmes is 1st of July 2020. The festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨49 Euros or $55 USD per film during the regular deadline. For short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes) the festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨9 Euros per film during regular deadline.
Discount code: use our Summer Sale code "SUMMER25" to recieve 25% of the entry fee. Discount is valid until the 1st of July.
The extended submission deadline for competitive and non-competitive feature film programmes is 17th of August 2020. The festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨65 Euros or $75 USD per film during extended deadline. For short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes) the festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨12 Euros per film during extended deadline.
The final submission deadline for competitive and non-competitive feature film programmes is 24th of August 2020. The festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨75 Euros or $85 USD per film during the regular deadline. For short or half-length films (up to 45 minutes) the festival asks a submission fee of ‚Ç¨20 Euros per film during final submission deadline.

‚Ä¢	Fill and submit the entry form via the festival‚Äôs online submission form.

‚Ä¢	Deliver additional materials (biography and filmography of Director, stills of the film, synopsis of the film, trailer and poster art-work (if already available) by the means specified by the festival.

If, for exceptional reasons, the film has to be withdrawn three weeks or less before the opening of the festival, the applicant agrees to reimburse all costs to the festival related to the confirmation and programming of the film including screening fee (when applicable), print delivery and handling costs as well as associated travel costs for the film delegation.
The invoices for the film rights or print loans should be issued and delivered for payments no later than two months after the end of the festival. The festival does not accept or reimburse invoices issued after that date.

‚Ä¢	Grant permission to include the screener in the festivals video library, reserved for jury and accredited industry members only (restricted access). The film representative will be requested to upload the screener into the secure video library environment.

DCPs must be provided and shipped on industry standard and protected hard drives or delivered digitally with previous confirmation from the festival technical department. Consumer grade hard drives and memory sticks are not permitted.

Telliskivi 60a/2, 3rd floor
10412
Tallinn, Estonia
Phone: +372 56 208 308
